definitions.definition: an action that is intended to deceive, either as a way of cheating someone, or as a joke or form of entertainment:
examples: She played a really nasty trick on me - she put syrup in my shampoo bottle!

definitions.definition: to be an effect caused by light, making something appear different:
examples: For a moment I thought you had a patch of grey hair, but it's just a trick of the light.

definitions.definition: what children say when they go  trick-or-treating  at Halloween
to deceive someone, often as a part of a plan:
examples: Dean tricked the old lady into giving him eight hundred dollars.

definitions.definition: used to deceive someone, either as a joke or form of entertainment or so that they makes a mistake:
